intro: Senecio mildbraedii, commonly known as the Mildbraed's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
